title.value: of Hotimsk district of Mohilev region in the feeding of young cattle [Belarus]
Трепел месторождения 'Стальное' Хотимского района Могилевской области в кормлении молодняка крупного рогатого скота [Беларусь]

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Agrarian Series

person.name: Kozinets, T.G., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)

abstract.value: Natural zeolites appear a type of fossils rather perspective for use in agriculture, including animal husbandry.  One of the most important directions of zeolites utilization is production of feed additives for animals and poultry, sewage sludge processing and absorbent producing. In practice of animal feeding zeolites are usually used as mineral complementary feeds containing almost all micro-and macro-elements, necessary for animals and also zeolites are applied for absorbing ability. Trepel, a natural zeolite containing clinoptilolite, possesses high absorbing properties, determined with its high porosity, large specific surface and high ion exchange capacity. All these qualities define a good absorber capacity of trepel, sucking radionuclides, water, fungal microorganisms, carbon dioxide and heavy metals out of gastrointestinal tract of animals. The paper deals with the results of research on the influence of different doses of trepel of the deposit

of Hotimsk region of Mohilev oblast in the concentrates for young stock. It's determined that the most effective dose of trepel in the concentrates is 2 %. The influence of trepel on hematological factors, productivity of young stock and economic efficiency is studied.
